examples: he speaks French with a trace of an accent

definitions.text: an indication that something has been present
examples: there wasn't a trace of evidence for the claim
a tincture of condescension
there was a touch of sarcasm in his tone
he detected a ghost of a smile on her face

definitions.text: a drawing created by superimposing a semitransparent sheet of paper on the original image and copying on it the lines of the original image
either of two lines that connect a horse's harness to a wagon or other vehicle or to a whiffletree
a visible mark (as a footprint) left by the passage of person or animal or vehicle
follow, discover, or ascertain the course of development of something
examples: We must follow closely the economic development is Cuba
trace the student's progress

definitions.text: make a mark or lines on a surface
examples: draw a line
trace the outline of a figure in the sand
we retraced the route we took last summer
trace your path
The hunters traced the deer into the woods
the detectives hounded the suspect until they found him
She traced the circumstances of her birth

definitions.text: make one's course or travel along a path; travel or pass over, around, or along
examples: The children traced along the edge of the dark forest
The women traced the pasture

definitions.text: copy by following the lines of the original drawing on a transparent sheet placed upon it; make a tracing of
examples: trace a design
trace a pattern
Can you decipher this letter?
The archeologist traced the hieroglyphs
